did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Odell Sneden Hathaway Theater Ledger Collection, 1910-1922
did.abstract: This collection is comprised of seven ledgers from theaters owned by Odell Sneden Hathaway. Each ledger lists daily accounting totals which denote the name of the attraction, weather conditions, gross receipt totals, costs, payments, and accompanying notes.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Odell Sneden Hathaway Theater Ledger Collection (MS 514). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Odell Sneden Hathaway was a governor of the International Theatrical Association as well as proprietor of several successful theaters located in the upper New York state and Upper Ohio regions. These theaters exhibited a myriad of entertainment forms to the public, including plays, burlesque shows, vaudeville acts, and motion pictures.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of seven ledgers from theaters owned by Odell Sneden Hathaway in the upper New York State Region and upper Ohio region. Each ledger lists daily accounts for acts (including plays, burlesque shows, vaudeville acts, and motion pictures), gross receipts, weather conditions, costs, payments, and notes. Often within the ledgers acts are listed in generic terms, such as “vaudeville”, but in some instances entries will list the headline performer, title of play or motion picture.
This series is arranged alphabetically by theater name. Ledgers in folders 5 and 6 contain accounting information for two theaters.
